001.comments: ARCL 228 - Forensic Anthropology:  In this course students will learn how forensic anthropologists apply methods from archaeology and biological anthropology to the identification, recovery, and analysis of skeletal remains from crime scenes, mass disasters, and unexplained deaths. The course follows the procedural steps a forensic anthropologist would undertake upon the discovery of unidentified human remains, including the determination of age, sex, stature, ancestry, and the identification of trauma.

description: The application of methods from biological anthropology and archaeology to the identification, recovery, and analysis of skeletal remains from crime scenes, mass disasters, and unexplained deaths.
